headers.subject: Re: Installing KDE2 with source!!

body.para: FIrst go to the directory of Your files than type in for the files: bunzip2 filename.tar.bz2 than u'll have files with *.tar ending U can unpack them with tar xzf file.tar

quote.quotepara: ----- Original Message ----- From: "David Orlow" <dmorlow@yahoo.com> To: "KDE User List" <kde-user@lists.netcentral.net> Sent: Saturday, November 25, 2000 2:06 PM Subject: Installing KDE2 with source!!
Ok, I want to upgrade. Actually I have tried a couple of times, but

have been unsucessful. But in the past I have done it with RPM files and this time I will just download the source, configure it, compile it and then install it. Hoping this will work better. But the files I am downloading now, instead of having a tar.gz extention on it, it has a tar.bz2 extention on it. How do I uncompress these files?
What is the best order to install these files in?
